caption: Registry Value
description: The registry value object describes a Windows registry value.
name: reg_value

data.description: The data of the registry value. Where the value type is known, implementers should instead use a type-specific attribute, i.e. reg_binary_data, reg_integer_data, reg_string_data, or reg_string_list_data.

modified_time.description: The time when the registry value was last modified.

name.description: The name of the registry value.

path.description: The full path to the registry key, where the value is located.

type.description: A string representation of the value type as specified in Registry Value Types.

3.caption: REG_DWORD_BIG_ENDIAN
3.description: A 32-bit integer in big-endian byte order.

4.caption: REG_EXPAND_SZ
4.description: A string containing unexpanded environment variables, e.g. %USERPROFILE%\Downloads.

5.caption: REG_LINK
5.description: A string containing the target path of a symbolic link created by calling RegCreateKeyEx with REG_OPTION_CREATE_LINK.

6.caption: REG_MULTI_SZ
6.description: A sequence of zero or more strings.

7.caption: REG_NONE
7.description: A value with no declared type.

9.caption: REG_QWORD_LITTLE_ENDIAN
9.description: Not defined in Windows documentation and previously added to OCSF in error.
